string.text: Who's gonna take off the mask?
%c[255,160,160,160]"Duty"\n%c[default]We have equipment problems, communication with the base and squads might malfunction for a couple days.
%c[255,160,160,160]"Duty"\n%c[default]Stalkers, join "Duty". Let's protect the planet from the Zone's infection!
%c[255,160,160,160]"Duty"\n%c[default]Need experienced stalkers for a mutant raid. Payment accordingly.
%c[255,160,160,160]"Duty"\n%c[default]Need experienced stalkers for a mutant spawn raid. Payment accordingly.
%c[255,160,160,160]Petrenko\n%c[default]We have temporary problems with the private channel, if anything - write to me privately.
%c[255,160,160,160]Voronin\n%c[default]All squads, get on the radio right now! General assembly on the channel!
%c[255,160,160,160]Petrenko\n%c[default]Stalkers, I can help get rare attachments for some guns. Come by, we'll discuss.
%c[255,160,160,160]Petrenko\n%c[default]Repeating, passage to the base - strictly by passes or my order.
%c[255,160,160,160]"Freedom"\n%c[default]Long live "Freedom"! Let's make the world better with the Zone's help!
%c[255,160,160,160]"Freedom"\n%c[default]Need experienced stalkers for an artifact raid. We'll pay what's due.

%c[255,160,160,160]"Freedom"\n%c[default]Loners! "Freedom" speaking! If you want to live in normal conditions in the Zone and without military obligations like "Duty" has - come to us! Always welcome new faces.
%c[255,160,160,160]"Freedom"\n%c[default]All of ours - urgently enter the private channel, we're updating protection. Don't complain later that "Duty" learned about your raid.
%c[255,160,160,160]"Freedom"\n%c[default]If you're on a mission, all information - to the private channel. Not only ours read this one, don't blow your cover.
%c[255,160,160,160]"Freedom"\n%c[default]Data on mercenary movements dump to me in private immediately, this is really important.
Saw how a Duty guy fought off dogs almost hand-to-hand. What kind of suit is that on him? They didn't even tear it!
Yeah looks like a Duty hunting suit, serious stuff! Duty gets them issued for special needs.

Vovchik Nose just died, got dragged into "Vortex" by his backpack, could see the backpack was full.\nProbably got tired from walking and didn't have strength to break free.\nTore the guy apart right before our eyes...
It's been known for ages: the main enemy of any stalker is their own greed!
What nastiness, where the hell do these zombies with dynamite in their guts come from?\nOr are they pumped up with propane? You kill one, chunks fly all over the place!
I avoid them completely and advise you to do the same.
The thugs have gone completely crazy, blocked all paths from Bar to Sakharov, barely escaped with my life!\nWhere are our "protectors" looking? Almost right under their noses!
Maybe you garbage collectors shouldn't go crawling everywhere and these freaks wouldn't be there! \nThey flock to you like flies to shit! And my boys have to risk their necks cleaning up the mess!

What a mess! Went for gas in the Valley. Just loaded up when dogs attacked in a pack.\nBeen sitting on a roof for two hours. Afraid to shoot, bandits are nearby. Anyone close? Split the gas profit fifty-fifty!
Wait for darkness, maybe they'll calm down.
Something about omens from Semetsky ain't working, every time they report something I step in some shit!
Shit is good, they say, means money, you'll get rich! We'll be jealous!
Killed a zombie, started searching him, got shocked like by electricity, and everything's swimming like from pseudo dog fumes.\nStrange, never had this before!
Ha, they can explode in general. All kinds of shit-gases accumulate in their guts. That's what hits you.
Killed an electric chimera, in Agroprom Research Institute from a cliff, checked - no claws, no kidneys. Well at least stayed alive, what a horrible beast! Until you see it yourself...
Killed a zombie, ugly face, bloated, started searching - cigarette case in pocket.\nVanka Tooth had one like that, I remember, could it be him? I first entered the Zone with him.
Even if so, you shot a zombie, and the Zone took Vanka.
Wanted to trade ammo with traders, but no cheap artifacts. And the trader disappeared. Will anyone trade?
At Yantar some scientist was trading. Go there if it's not far.
Sidor swore since evening that he desperately needed pseudo dog tails. But he left in the morning...\nThat's not right. Could've written, hell, he's not some green kid.
What were you drinking? Sidor wrote three times that he was leaving on business. You're slow, brother!
Scientists at Yantar are looking for volunteers to take measurements at a location,\nI looked at where exactly, and I wouldn't go there for all the riches!
Exactly, let them crawl out of their bunker themselves!
Got a SPAS, it really saved me!\nAt the hangar exit snorks attacked, thought I was done... Anyway, investment paid off completely!
What's that? A new medicine? What does it help with?
That Sakharov! I brought him a couple "Fireballs", and he gives me this sly smile:\n"If you bring three, I'll offer some excellent loot".\nCouldn't he say that earlier?? What a scoundrel!
I don't carry stuff there, well maybe some useless junk. Sidorovich is better. He's fair.
Listened to all the talk about Yantar. What a paradise! Barely escaped from snorks and zombies. Even saw an electric chimera, screw it!
Go there at night. Everything's quiet then.
Kuzya, that kind soul... gave away all the healing wheels to some junkies. And the next shipment, bet he'll raise the price...
You're the junkie! We're preparing for a raid - a serious one! Not wearing out pants at Cordon like some people...
Saved up for an AKM for ages. Got it. Nice piece even if it shoots crooked.\nBut damn, problem with ammo, it'll bankrupt me, I can feel it...
Yeah no problem, you can make deals with soldiers, and they peddle at Bar.

Damn it all to hell! Stingy with vodka for grenades, and in Agroprom Research Institute ran into zombies!\nResult: 4 mags for the Kalash and ate all the sausage, and profit - one claw, barely escaped..
A claw, you say? Selling? I'm at the Swamps, near the church.
At Yantar looked at the factory through binoculars, so many zombies there... And all former stalkers!\nCan't figure out what makes people go there? Really just greed?
They say they're not quite people. Well, like there were a couple of such idiots, and the Zone multiplies them. Maybe they're lying.

At Garbage in the hangar a rookie with a shattered leg has been suffering for two days,\nleg's blue, looks like gangrene maybe. Anyone know medicine?\nFeel sorry for the kid - good soul, plays guitar great.
At Agroprom in the swamp you can sometimes see artifacts, but the water's murky, and climbing blind into radiation doesn't appeal.
Guys, if anyone finds a working generator from a ZIL, I'd take it.\nGot an idea with the guys to make a station at Agroprom, have an engine with frame,\nwould charge batteries.
You should go... to Melitopol. There you could run your auto service. This is the Zone, brother.
Rushing to the camp in the dark, emission started, ran into a burer, shot him point-blank with both barrels,\nbut he seemed not to see me, blinded by the emission maybe?
Maybe blinded. Emission, it's rough, brother...
Tooth, you bastard, seems to me last time you gave me fake shit,\nnot the real recipe. The world is round...
Go kill yourself! I told you: cooking artifacts needs skill!
Guys, I'm back with you, thanks to the doctors - patched me up, whoever from the old-timers remembers, welcome to Bar, I'll be glad to meet!
Hey! What, ribs healed, threw away crutches and back in action? Glad to hear you, devil! I'll be there, pour me one!
Going to Bar with our guys. Let Barkeep put on a more decent tux!\nMeeting such people in a vest is bad manners!
You'll answer for bad manners! Come on then, show up, chatterboxes, there's business brewing in your profile.
What crap, two burers, two bloodsuckers, six boars, eight dogs - and only two good tails!\nStocked up on sausage for the raid, yeah right! Buckshot, damn, what a waste...
Need to know the spots... Hunter.
Found a soldier's corpse, letters from girlfriend in pocket. Well we at least go for loot, but they go for regulations...\nSorry for the kid, even though the damn soldiers are annoying!
Ran into a pseudogiant - 5 shots from underslung launcher, he didn't care, good thing I was carrying F1 for a rainy day, it saved me.
Lately these overgrown chickens have multiplied! Can't go anywhere without grenades!
Three weeks in the Zone, time to go home, but losses more than profit, need to quit... Not the same Zone anymore, not the same...
My son pulled a stunt, decided to apply to military academy! I told him: "Good boy, son! You'll be chasing daddy through the Zone!" What a helper I raised!
That's it! Quitting drinking! Left hungover in the morning, and a semi-transparent boar floats toward me,\nI shoot, guys swear. Nobody else saw it. Drank myself to white elephants!
You need to get out of the Zone! This happens in heads if you hang around here too long.
Listened to those bastards - threw Kalash in "Jelly", then emission. Ran away.\nCame back - no "Jelly", no Kalash!
What fools in the Zone, and I thought they'd die out on their own...
A guy while drunk bragged he could turn a simple "Jellyfish" into green one.\nSobered up, denies it, but seems he knows after all. Maybe someone's in the know? Drinks on me!
Go to Tooth at the bar, if not him, then I don't know...

What a laugh! A rookie brought Sidorovich a green "Jellyfish", but it was ordinary one painted with green antiseptic!\nSidorovich almost strangled him, and the guy starts crying, some scammer sold it to him for 5 bottles and medkit turns out!
Paint with antiseptic, you say? Hmm...
Got batteries from scientists at Swamps - normal ones, but at Sidorovich's they die instantly, does he keep them from World War II or what?
Maybe he uses them differently? When he closes shop...
Stupidly ordered a belt for 5 artifacts, sitting and thinking, what for? Never had need to carry so many and drain battery. Maybe someone needs it, cheap...
Near the transition from Cordon to Garbage on the right side by a boulder there was a mine turns out,\nand I went there a couple times. Saw a dog get blown up by explosion.
Whose jokes are these? Catch them and!.. We don't have enough anomalies.
Dogs chased me onto a rock, knocked out rifle, got out automatic - same thing,\ngood thing had PM with two clips, it saved me.
Damn tired of these rookies! Who cares what fell out of where for you?
One guy sold sausage made here, how do you eat this stuff?\nLike hell you can chew it, and smells like socks, could die from it.
Go to mama, home, there are tasty pies. Damn gourmets showed up...
One guy bragged about MP5 automatic for PM ammo.\nAnyone know how to get one like that?
Sidorovich sent me for loot, gave two days, I returned in one day, and he disappeared, what a weasel!
Like he'd wait for you with pies. He's got half the Zone like you.
At the bar, southern checkpoint, dogs almost ate the entire squad, the guards overslept...
Offered a silencer for AKM, worth taking?\nThey say it helps well against blind dogs from distance.
You're an idiot! How the hell does a silencer help?
This dry rations is so annoying! If only Sidor traded instant noodles or something.\nI'd cook such soup with canned meat!
Don't like it - go to mommy! She'll treat you.
Agreed to bring hooves to Barkeep, ran all over, spent tons of buckshot, collected, brought,\nand he turns his nose up: "Don't need them anymore, got enough." Pfft, never again..
Oh, what a hunter we lost! What will happen now...
What's happening in the world anyway? Been in the Zone a month,\nat least they could send news by SMS,\nI'm tired of listening to your whining about dogs and rodents!
What's what... They steal, rob, and cause trouble... Everything as usual.
Is it true that Red Forest has tons of artifacts?
Yes. Go there. Meet the bloodsucker uncles.
Guys, who remembers Vovchik Boatswain? He's gone.\nWent to Limansk, wasn't afraid of anything, but at home some punks stabbed him in an alley.
Yeah... Man is monster to man...

They say bandits found a super-secret laboratory,\nand soldiers found out and sent special forces. In that lab, they say, dangerous experiments were done,\nso it exploded across the whole Zone from there.

Do zombies in Agroprom Research Institute not see? They walk by sound right?
One stalker advised me to tear foam from car seats
and tie it to boots, says you can walk past them, they don't bother you.
Not lying?
I won a case of vodka from Stas! I told you I was lucky!\nAnd he says - you're a cheat! What cheat? If I'm naturally lucky...
I won a case of vodka from Stas! I told you I was lucky!\nAnd he says - you're a cheat! What cheat? If I'm naturally lucky...
In Agroprom Research Institute ran from pseudo dogs, climbed in truck body,\nthose beasts followed me. Barely fought them off!
So tired of listening to these stupid rookies...
Traded vodka for body armor from soldiers and joyfully flew into "Greed".\nHad to drop backpack with armor and container.\nAnd I was hauling vodka from Cordon, better if I drank that vodka there!
Hell's happening in Dark Valley. Soldiers blocked the bridge, barely escaped,\nnot enough bandits with monsters, now these service guys too, damn them...
They said there's an operation there, why'd you go?
At Sanatorium two dogs attacked, and there never was anything\nbut rodents running around.
Hunters got completely bold, used to trade tail for sausage, now take couple tails for one ration, bastards!
Don't want - don't take, go to Sidorovich...

At Forgotten Hamlet ran nose to nose into a burer,
six meters away, shot from underslung in panic.
Killed the bastard, but suit got shredded and arm cut in two places above elbow.
Have to get out of Zone home, and I'm almost empty.
Burer at Hamlet? Stop lying!\nProbably shot yourself, fool.
Why'd they lie that there are women at Swamps?\nNothing's there, just monsters.
To some even a pig is a woman... Go hit on the fleshes...
Why'd they lie that there are women at Swamps? Nothing's there, just monsters.

Yeah there was some crazy one, looking for husband supposedly,\nso they said, already moved beyond perimeter. Screw them, at home they annoyed with their whims and wants.\nBecause of them mainly we climb into this hole.
They say military wanted to wipe out bandits in Dark Valley.\nSent special forces, wanted to take Borov's base under control like at Agroprom,\nand then Bar too, well to kick out stalkers completely.
That's nothing! I heard they'll soon start bombing with nuclear bombs! Need to get out!
Heard that hunters can tan flesh hides and\nmake cool cloaks, they say even automatic bullets don't penetrate them.\nProbably lying.

Found remains of stalker corpse in "Fruit Punch",\njudging by equipment was experienced stalker, how'd he get caught?\nAlmost everything eaten by acid, only scraps left of exoskeleton and rifle. Damn...
Screw it! Your cooking experiments are complete shit!\nTwice tried to cook "Chunk", wasted all artifacts,\nand result - nothing, how do people manage to get something???
Need to know the method. Throwing random crap is being an idiot.
Just now a pair of helicopters passed over me heading north. Coordinates attached. We're staying low, I don't know what their orders are.
Is it true that if you throw a dead battery into "Electra" for an hour, it charges?
Sure! And if you sit on it bare-assed, speed and jumping increase!
Ha, listen guys, found stash with real loot and ID for one Cherepakhin V.I.\nWhat a fool, bringing ID to Zone!\nWell you guys - put on a good song for this Turtle!
You beast! I got your number...
Ran into boars at Swamps, some armored ones, spent tons of ammo... And darker colored than usual.
Ran into a burer! At Cordon! Barely managed to draw knife, if not for green "Jellyfish" on belt,\nhe would've flattened me, but I got him.
You mean that corpse that's been lying stinking near the farm for third week? Yeah right, keep talking.
I reinforced my suit at Swamps with scientists, cool thing, shame it's temporary.
What's this talk? What tailors appeared there? Is it old Stepanych?
Saw a guy with army rations, now that's proper grub! Nothing like our sausage and bread!
Shouldn't have traded buckshot for birdshot! Buckshot hits tighter. But damage is similar.
I traded for a leather coat from guys, good thing, but Wergas won't repair it,\nand walking to Lanky... And will he even take it? Maybe someone knows?
No, Lanky will refuse too... I heard some old man, something like that, makes stuff at Swamps...
Sidor covers matches in his basement with wet rags. From evil eye or what? They don't light at all!
Well I'll be damned, said at Agroprom there's a soldier you can stock up from for vodka normally,\nbut there's a fire poltergeist! Spilled half the vodka while running from it.
Yeah? I heard they killed him. Or is there another one?
Going by bearing to helicopter crashed at Swamps. Nobody yet.
Observing mutant wave, coming from northwest, see attached coordinates.
Observing mutant wave, coming from northern canyon.
Observing mutant wave, coming from east, presumably from Dark Valley.
Mayday, pack of dogs heading straight at us, exact coordinates attached!
Water ran out, cleaned mask with energy drink, guys, don't repeat my mistake,\ncan't see shit. Everything stuck together, even vodka won't clean it.
You're an idiot... Too lazy to stock up on water?
Guys, sawed-off is great! Kills zombies perfectly, if it tries to get up, can finish with knife while it twitches.
First day in Zone? Any rookie knows that.
Found treasure at Swamps in village.\nChampagne bottle full of ten-kopeck coins, anyone interested?
Why would anyone need that... Well bring it, maybe I'll give a pack of ammo...
Dan got completely greedy, used to pay ten rounds per tail,\nnow dropped to five. Won't go to Agroprom Research Institute anymore..
Did you think this was a store? Too many like you showed up...
Our rookie decided to eat boar meat, while cooking the stench was terrible, tried to eat it, threw up, now the gourmet's had diarrhea for two days.
In village at Army Warehouses found German carbine under floorboard,\nhidden since war apparently, seems working, in grease, just no ammo. Anyone interested in antique?
Here's a guy showing strange artifact, looks like kolobok,\nsays he took it from burer. That one supposedly repels dogs, if true, cool thing. Tired of blind mutts already!
I found a scythe at hamlet, sharp, maybe take to Wergas to attach straight handle to fight off dogs?
Uh-oh... Didn't see a dark figure in robe there? Expect visitors...
We have problem, stalker badly burned. What to do? Injected medkit.
Piss on him quickly, just don't laugh, my grandpa told me,\nthey did this at front. Works as antiseptic,\nthen put on bandages.
About 20 pseudo dogs attacked, used all buckshot, caught breath, but only one corpse,\nall others vanished. Damn...
From fear even 100 might seem real.
Pseudo dog attacked, barely shot it!
Ignat, well the hunter in Agroprom Research Institute, treated me to such shit... Thought I'd die... Going again tomorrow.
Anyone have clear tape? Mask cracked. Breathing poison.
Should have spare. Where are you?
Saw group of some shady guys, presumably "Freedom", going toward Bar.
Group of about ten bodies moving from Radar toward Barrier, presumably zombies. Take measures.
Understood. Fed up already, keep coming and coming, damn them...
Damn, lost vest, blind dogs tore it! Anyone have one?
Wergas was offering one at Cordon recently. Expensive, I didn't take it.
Mayday, mercs trapped us at Agroprom in central complex!
Why can't you all just chill... idiots
Helicopter flew somewhere north.\nWish it would drop us couple crates of canned meat here.
They drop for whoever pays. Everyone wants freebies...
Guys, I'm in trouble... At Swamps. Ammo's out, any rat could finish me, what to do?
If you have food, go to soldiers in south,\nwho shine searchlight. They might help.
Rookies brought crates again... Think there's artifacts - shovel them up and fill crates.
Guys, who'll watch my artifacts while I'm on expedition? I'll reward...
Duty keeps them, or go to Sanya the trader, but no guarantee there...
Lukash, killed the mercs, going home.
Met pseudo dog, barely shot it! Rifle jerked around like someone was pulling it in different directions!
Yeah, they mess up aim, these damn pseudo dogs!
Going to Agroprom Research Institute to shoot monsters. Anyone coming?
I can imagine local monsters reporting: "Stalker came for lunch - anyone want to taste?"
Anyone have repair kits for body armor?
Guys! Got new recipes for getting good artifacts! Come to bar...
Yeah you bastard, you'll leave us broke for nothing!
Heard that Artist died... Saw his Zone sketches, really liked them. Nobody found his album? I'd buy if not expensive.
Heard military radio chatter, they're planning some operation at Yantar.
Completely green "Gravi" deflated! Missed the emission...\nWas so great with it...
Well, go to Misty Grove, one guy told me,\nthat in "Labyrinth" there artifacts get good again, though might be bullshit.
Damn! Varyag slept nearby and in morning turned into dried mummy!\nWhat's this new plague?
Plague called - own stupidity!\nSure didn't turn off activator with endurance artifacts.\nThey sucked all life energy out of him...
Lukash, "Duty" came to hamlet again. Why?
"Duty" is always where needed! And whoever doubts - let them dig their grave...
Need internet access. Is there at bar, or drag myself to Sidorovich?
Barkeep seems to have it. Basically, you could try going to "Duty" radio operators, they definitely have access.
Vitalik Soaker got torn apart by dogs right near Duty checkpoint!\nSome protectors...
Yeah he's slow. Recently won hunting armor from me\nand hid it somewhere at Duty guys. Should've worn it - dogs would've broken all teeth on it.
Looking for recipe for "Granny's beads", willing to pay...
What, you new? Everyone knows: Tooth has everything!
If anyone needs ways to cook artifacts, come by...
What, is there a way to cook "Mama's beads" from any shit?
Sitting in basement, then crack - "Jellyfish" behind me hissed... Nearly shit myself...
Yeah, and "Drop" hit me in head once! Zone...
People! How to save artifacts from emission?!! Lost "Soul"!
What are you, village fool... rookie just got out?\nNeed to put artifacts in container! Then emission won't get them.
Oh man... How my head's splitting after yesterday! Can't recover...
What, you masochist? Down an energy drink, you'll recover instantly...
Guys, anyone sell cheap suit with good mask?\nWant to try exploring new places, but don't have much money.
Try going to Sanatorium, maybe Lyokha has something not completely falling apart.
Ivar, I brought you paying client, get on radio urgently!
Need stalker, specialist in code locks, with experience in northern Zone raids.
I heard Americans sent some superman of theirs to us.\nWill be interesting to see him.
That four-eyes? Seems he got killed...
Don't go in basements, full of creatures! Go around on surface!
Khemul, urgently get to bar, got business!
Where do fleshes with normal eyes live? I need them urgently!
Come to us at Agroprom Research Institute, got couple herds here...
Food spoils quickly. How to go on long expedition?
Get hunting sausage from us. It doesn't spoil. Almost...
Guys! Be careful in village at Warehouses - "Burning fuzz" piled up on poles there!
Oh boy, zombies full again at Yantar! Be careful there, guys!
If anyone near me - come by, trade bad artifacts for good ones.
Glad to know they haven't shot you yet, buddy...
Stalkers! Sakharov pays good money for loot! And keeps looking for someone to send to X-16...\nI somehow don't risk it... Radiation's wild there, fries brains, and zombies...
Dear stalkers. We have already covered the need for bloodsucker body parts. Sorry...
I thought I wouldn't make it in time...
Guys. What's that shit at ATP, at Cordon! Old ZIL starts up?
Haven't they killed all the hunters yet? They're totally fed up!
Guys, what's with the ZIL at ATP starting up? Creepy!
Dan's a bastard, wouldn't let me pass without a hoof! Give to someone who doesn't mind!
Heard screams at Swamps... Seemed like women's! In the east...
Hallucinations from hunger... Fact! Though they say fleshes sometimes scream like that...
This is Barkeep from Bar. Guys, "Flashes" not needed for orders right now. When needed - I'll announce.
Fine then, I'll trade with someone...
Rich stash at Garbage found! Heh-heh-heh...
Helicopter crashed in Valley! Bandits already there...
Here naked guys are falling from sky! Imagine that...
Eh... Better if it were women...
Associate professor's got brains! Cracks codes like sunflower seeds.
About hooves by order: customer refused, so no longer needed...
Sidor, be more careful choosing customers, or we'll beat your face in...
Where's Sultan? Seems he got kicked out of Bar? Where to get weapons?
Yeah he's there, near northern checkpoint - behind fence.
They say Mole's group got wiped. Mercenaries shot them all...
Again truck was carrying dead bodies. Almost reached Cordon...
We got passenger from there! Alive!
Antokha's an idiot! I told him: don't take what's not yours! Got a bullet...
Who heard where good artifacts are still left?
Maybe you want apartment keys too?
Saw Raven at farm, takes all kinds of junk, gives gear...
Buddies, any normal food left? Scum grabs everything for himself...
Hook disappeared in Grove! Told him: cursed place!
Rusty, bastard! Where are you? Return the common fund! I'll kill you!
Can't get to Bar! Anomaly upon anomaly! Maybe someone has map with safe path? I'm at Garbage for now...
Can't provide limousine? What rookies we get! Everyone wants to ride into paradise on someone else's back!
Heard? Tons of vodka at bandits in Valley!
Everyone who looked for "Twists" for me! Anyway, that's it, no longer needed...
Great... And I like fool climbed into anomaly for "Twist"...
Ha! I reached Pripyat! And back!
You'll rub your hands raw, lover...
I respect Kuznetsov, if not for his ammo - dogs would've eaten me...
Beat up Hairy! So life doesn't seem like honey to him!
Prapor... Good man... Would sell Motherland for bottle...
Baldy's a cheat! Lost all my money to him...
Used to beat such with candelabra...
For recipe missing "Flash", anyone have? Won't short-change...
Brothers Zhorik and Garik are going on expedition...
Anyone know how to find Doctor?
Caught something, sick guy? Hell you'll find him now.
They say Doctor showed up again. Who saw?
Hung around Cordon for while. Maybe still there, hell knows.\nFind him - tell me where.
Can't get to Warehouses now? Seemed there was always path.
Everything changes - this is Zone. Ask at bar.
Who knows, is Guide really a guide or just nickname?
Ask him yourself, just find him first.
Whoa! Found whole crate of ammo, though all for Makarov, wish I could find so much for Kalash.
Stalkers! Come to Bar, enlist in ranks of humanity's defenders!
...Everyone gets separate bed.\nEven nightstand. We'll give soap, schnapps... this was somewhere before.
They say sect appeared in Zone - Controller's Debtors.
Got high again? Soon he'll come to you himself.
Yeah, cheap! Cheaper to buy Mercedes.
Sanka Drunk got rid of "Black mark", imagine. Alive.
Just lucky. One chance in hundred.
Mayday, chimeras, pack, what to do?!
Idiot, run, what else. Or climb somewhere high, wait it out.
Damn it all! Used all ammo, but didn't shoot any tails\nor heads. Maybe someone will sell?
Go to Hunter in forest, buy whatever you want from him.
Those bitches. Well Bar has only Duty guys - should be honest people.\nThey searched my stash.
Stop whining... Look among stalkers.\nSpecially opened storage for you fools.
Where to look for these artifacts, in grass? Don't see shit.
Artifacts aren't mushrooms. Go out at night, if not scared, - you'll see from kilometer away.
Damn, I was carrying "Gravi" to someone, forgot. Whoever ordered from me, respond.
Should drink less, drunk, and write down if brain's full of holes. Run, bring it!
Demon, don't wait for me. Gave armor for repair, won't go naked.
Too hard to get second while first's being fixed? Childish excuses.
Guys, got into Misty Grove. Some shit here - electronics fail.
And I sold my night vision, thought it was broken.
Found stash at Garbage with 3 thousand NATO rounds. Couldn't carry it.
So that's where our ammo turned up... Someone's getting it.
Holy shit how much!! Definitely not lying that after emission you can find artifacts.
Like we didn't know without you. By the way, where are you?
Fourth broken truck and all with same number. What's this mean - they're all identical?
Means you've been walking around same truck for four days, druggie.
Damn. Found artifact, accidentally dropped it, and anomaly formed.\nHow it happened, I don't understand.
Come by, tell what you did... for reward.
Oh mama! Some thing flying, like electric, but doesn't bite.\nI shoot at it, but it doesn't care.
Doesn't bite, so why waste ammo? Better bring us if you have extra.
Fed up already, rookies, with this news!! Discovery he made! They always hang around there.
I bought recipe here, expensive, damn! But artifact with full protection from everything won't cook! Help!
Yeah... Fools haven't died out in Russia...
Fed up with these "Jellies"! New armor to trash...
Exactly, what garbage! Even nail polish came off!
Hiding from people, drunk. Conscience must be eating him...
Barefoot croaked. Left map from Guide as inheritance...
Don't rush to deal with Guide, he seems to scam everyone.
If you see Guide, shoot the bastard...
What did he do to you? Well he's sick in head, so just shoot him...
Some eggheads appeared at Swamps - studying doggies...
Found PDA, Vitka Lame's, rest his soul...\nCan't pick password! Anyone know what his mother was called?

And rightly so! Everyone has to deal with consequences...

Went to the Sanatorium, and there's a burer! Wasn't Lyoha's stash there?

And should sign under the bait - Yashka Gypsy, duty officer for the stash.\nInteresting, they don't collect artifacts, but three caravans with "Zone spawn" leave for the mainland monthly. Maybe bloodsuckers and burers pay off the squads?

Yesterday I saw a bloodsucker, and a stalker was standing next to it. Well, I think, the stalker's done for!\nSuddenly I see they kinda said goodbye, shook hands-paws and parted ways! Must be, the vodka was bootleg yesterday, to see such things.

Rain droplets on dark roofs - 
Castanets chiming. 
Quiet rustle barely heard. 
In gray cigarette smoke 
Aromas dissolved 
Of water pouring from sky... 
And under ringing thunderclaps 
A world woven from emptiness.

dark one...

Selling $item. Meet me at $level.\nHurry up or I'll change my mind.

lucky he didn't let it get close, and so

All around water flows with murky foam,
Washing away withered leaves in its wake.

wait, there's a diagram with indicators here... you're here, and... damn, what's that?!

Romantic...

At the checkpoint by the passage to Garbage cats showed up from somewhere,\ndamn things, hard to pass - running around like mad.\nWhoever can, please help arrange a cleanup for these creatures.

All dosimeters and sensors are silent, and Sergey's PDA broke down...

Raise power by ten percent.\nYes, and tell the radio operators to switch to another channel...\nthis one doesn't seem to be encrypted...

Go ahead guys... at night... after bloodsuckers... alone. Extreme sports, damn.

Damn it... so here's the deal, listen up.
$where I ran into a military patrol. It looks, to put it mildly, not so good...
you can hardly call it a patrol. They didn't quite hang guts from trees. Only recognized them by the uniform...
So here's what. First, they might send a punitive raid here or, worse, a chopper.
Second, what worries me much more, some new creature has shown up here.
All I know is that patrols can't be ripped apart this fast.
Something Semenetsky's been coming around too often... Maybe he's warning?
And I always look at ravens, they definitely know!
Look for better shelter, Emission is $when.
$level they shot down a helicopter. Backup will show up now...
Creatures are getting restless. Emission soon. Most likely $when.

filled with lead like a turkey

Lucky he didn't let it get close, and so
$who thanked you. Said you killed $target. Left a package for you with me.
Oh, how great! Clouds are - dispersing.
And you don't hear thunder anymore, notice?
Getting sick of this! I'll meet him - gonna shoot!
Stalkers! $where, according to our data, an... unusual creature appeared.\nMost likely, a new chimera variant that mutated under influence of the last Emission.\nBe careful.

...think that ultimately, this might lead to completely unnecessary casualties?

prefer not to be interested in details of how their... colleagues die.
So what now? I don't think the appearance of some new creature will cause serious reaction from stalkers.

I think it's better you don't know everything. You'll sleep more peacefully.

Semenetsky kicked the bucket! Means the raid will be successful!
Guys, my equipment's starting to go off the scale. Most likely, Emission will be $when.
Kruglov warned that Emission will be $when. So find yourselves a cozy burrow.
No lightning visible. Looks like storm's ending.

Apparently, nothing's even left of the pilots. $level. What it takes to blow up a helicopter like that. Damn...
$who came by here, left you something. When you're around - take it.
Oh! Heard about Semenetsky? Means it's time to hit the road, while luck's with us...
Looks like rain will end soon.
Went to ecologists at Yantar. They warned that by their readings Emission will be $when.
$carefull_a! $level it's hot now - chopper's ironing the area.

I'm asking nicely - don't bug me! Next time you won't get away with just a beaten face...

by the sawmill where hunters settled

Yura kicked the bucket again! Good sign.

Penetrated southern tunnel of the Object.
Goes down, will soon descend underground.
From windows visible thick growths of strangely reddish shade..
Quiet so far.
$level observing helicopter, it got shot down!\nFalling down! Holy shit someone really nailed it.
by grocery store where Mikhalych is
Large pack of flesh ran through Freedom's minefield.\nHalf died, and the rest are still wandering around there in the open.
Wow, gonna be a hefty storm.
Damn your mother... $level chopper's shooting someone. Poor guy's unlucky.
Yeah. Generally, it's rare for them to forget to close frequencies.
Thunder's rumbling. Means it's not just rain - it's a storm.
Dawn broke. Moving out, it's more or less safe now.
Seems like it's gonna rain. And we just got ready to go for loot...
For reasonable money will give $item.\n$level waiting for buyers.

Sun looks from the skies.

Kind, radiant...

Eh, something got me feeling poetic...
Can anyone hear me? Tonight a group of our guys went missing.\nShould have returned from Agroprom by morning. Still no sign. In an hour we're going searching. Join us.
Marked One, $who came by here. Happy, grin from ear to ear. Left a package, says it's thanks for you.
Seems like it brightened up? Soon this dampness will end.
Turn on encryption, damn you! Will be there in 12 hours.

Stalkers! Several hours ago Duty suffered heavy losses from unknown creatures.
Everyone who has information about mutations that occurred in Zone beings
after the last Emission, please help.
$where the attack happened...

Met Swamp Doctor... well, kinda met... he healed me a bit from blind dog bites, but that's not important. Important is that he warned about Emission. Says Emission will happen $when, so everyone into burrows!
Just saw near swamp in Dark Valley\nhow pack of pseudos took down two boars.\nNot a sight for weak nerves.
Last night one stalker saw\nhow two-three more bloodsuckers migrated\ninto bloodsucker village. Creepy!
Look at the rats, they're washing - means weather will be good.
Getting brighter, probably gonna stop pouring soon.
People, it's getting light - I think we can move out now.\nWon't run into much now, not like at night.

Falcon, what...
[transmission error]
...that might appear?
During last descent whole recon group disappeared.
Who is this? Military? Scientists? Jokers? Or someone... else?

District Center. Observing several Electrochimera specimens,\nneed help.. Who's nearby, respond.
Emission will be $when. I'm telling you for sure.
You sure? Yesterday they said same thing, where was it?
Well here we go - rain again.
So at ecologists' base, in church, at mechanical yard... where there are people, hide there.
Near camp at Cordon under bridge spotted pseudodog.\nEveryone heading there, be careful.
And weather's still super. Should get a tan :)
thought of running - but nowhere to go. Well, and

$carefull_a! $level helicopter's circling.\nLooks like they're searching for someone.
Oh, these tushkanos! Getting tired of them!\nAgain ran into rookie camp like shit,\nso whoever's scared of rodents, don't come to us for now.
Eh, guys! Finally getting light, or else\nI got tired of shaking with fear in darkness.\nBetter in daylight... to shake...
Couple more bangs and sky will clear...
Is it true that when Semenetsky dies - it's for luck?
Shortly before this dropped PDA, otherwise I couldn't have identified him.
Where this time? Did I miss something
Vergas' hemorrhoids sense an emission. Heh-heh... Most likely $when.

$level helicopter flew over me $when_a.\nWhat the hell are they flying around for now? Didn't hear about any planned cleanups or operations here,\nand my sources are reliable. Something serious happened. $carefull_a.
From Limansk to Red Forest a Controller went out..\nAlmost laid out a bunch of people on the bridge.
All squads, in the Gut near railway bridge\na controller appeared. Strong specimen, they say, be ready for surprises.
Less lightning now. Looks like storm's ending.
Borzyi's thugs got in trouble here, right next to them in tunnel\na burer settled and screams at night.\nDon't know what to do..
Everyone attention!\nScientists report suspicious mutant activity at Yantar tonight.\nEveryone stay in camps.
Last time they said same about Emission!\nI waited like a fool while guys got rich with loot!
Don't be happy that rain's ending - look at the clouds.
Sakharov warned that Emission will be $when. So find yourselves a cozy burrow.
Couldn't waste this beast, so guys, be careful.

$where observing electrochimera.
Just laid out group of stalkers with spectacular fireworks.
So if you want to wander here, think twice.
Turn around and leave - it's better than lying here with smoking ass, like these poor bastards.
$who came by here and passed you something. When you're nearby - come by, pick up your stuff. Benefactor.
At least it's dripping less now.
At night they arrange... quietly, so to speak...
and why did he die? Who knows... THE ZONE brother!
You are one of us. He is waiting for you...
Seems like something changed... Looks like artifacts work differently when collected together.

Must be that very telecode received... Interesting, what's the message there?\nMaybe to hell with this Borzyi and his accomplices?! Take the radio... at least to that same Docent.\nAnd colleagues will be safer too.
Marked One, I finished with your radio. Come to Bar and don't forget about payment.
Coordinates of location from decrypted message from Borzyi's radio
in evening, closer to night - around %s hours...

\nBy the way, you remember what the container looks like? Here, look:
Give me one bottle for now, we'll see then...

%s rubles from you. Or you can pay with simple artifact, but it should be in good condition.

I can give you money %s rubles, not bad eh?\nOr here are grenades for grenade launcher %s pieces. Agree, come on!"
Saw how one stalker with mangled face wasted a guy. You can expect anything from such type.

He's in charge here at the camp, teaching the rookies and protecting them. He's wandered the Zone plenty, experience isn't lacking. There are rumors he's planning to retire and has stashed a decent loot somewhere nearby. Some have even tried to get him to spill about it, but he's silent as a fish... Petruha once let slip when drunk that Wolf hid the main part of his loot at Forgotten Village. Would love to take a look at what's there. Bet no one else has anything like it...

He used to be considered a lucky stalker, but lately prefers not to stick his neck out, either stepped on someone's tail or something else... Now he hangs around as one of Sidor's guards. Knows, damn, where to get vodka, but doesn't sell it, and out of boredom suggests playing dice... Some even manage to win against him...
Know what they say about Stas?

He's been a trader since childhood! In kindergarten he sold colored pencils. In school he traded chewing gum. In institute he dealt light drugs. When the Zone appeared, he figured you could make good money from this. Famous for being able to establish good trade relations with the most diverse clients. Better not to quarrel with him, or you won't hide even outside the Zone... Oh, if I could find his winter stores! They say he has whole warehouses buried, with vodka and grub. I even roughly know - somewhere at Forgotten Village there is...

He's one of us... A warrior, of course, and if you go head-on, he'll order you wasted with a clear conscience, but he has a weakness for the people's drink - vodka. For a bottle he'll let you through, for several he'll even hook you up with gear... He's been hanging around here for a long time, they say he has no family, so he doesn't rotate out, you could say - a local landmark... And you know where he gets ammo for trade? One soldier let slip that he has a warehouse somewhere in Swamp. Seems he managed to write off a bunch of ammo somehow, and stashed it all himself. Now he trades it for vodka. Must be a decent warehouse. If only I could find at least part of it...
Had dealings with Kuznetsov, the major?

Incredibly lucky stalker. Many times his group was on the brink of death, and he was always the only one who managed to escape. Among stalkers he has a bad reputation as an unlucky talisman. For some time now he's been going solo. Better not to get involved with him, you'll be healthier...

Though he's new to the Zone, he's shown himself to be a decent guy... Went into the Zone depths a couple times and though he didn't bring back big loot, it wasn't for nothing. He doesn't charge into danger pointlessly, but doesn't hide behind his comrades' backs either. Enjoys special favor from Wolf, who often sends him on important tasks... Wolf recently got offended at Petruha. All because Petruha hid a couple of good artifacts from him somewhere in Dark Valley. Greed - it's understandable, who wants to share. But I'd look for those artifacts...

He's in charge here at the camp, teaching the rookies and protecting them. He's wandered the Zone plenty, experience isn't lacking. There are rumors he's planning to retire and has stashed a decent loot somewhere nearby. Some have even tried to get him to spill about it, but he's silent as a fish... Seems Nimble said that somewhere at Garbage he hid part of his loot, probably lying...

He used to be considered a lucky stalker, but lately prefers not to stick his neck out, either stepped on someone's tail or something else... Now he hangs around as one of Sidor's guards. Knows, damn, where to get vodka, but doesn't sell it, and out of boredom suggests playing dice... Some even manage to win against him... They were saying here that some supplier constantly brings him vodka from Swamp. Somehow long ago they brought a whole train car of vodka into the Zone through Swamp. Well, Stas and that guy were the first to stumble upon such a freebie, stashed as much as they could in different places in Swamp, and now they're living it up on this.
Know what they say about Stas?

He's been a trader since childhood! In kindergarten he sold colored pencils. In school he traded chewing gum. In institute he dealt light drugs. When the Zone appeared, he figured you could make good money from this. Famous for being able to establish good trade relations with the most diverse clients. Better not to quarrel with him, or you won't hide even outside the Zone...

He's one of us... A warrior, of course, and if you go head-on, he'll order you wasted with a clear conscience, but he has a weakness for the people's drink - vodka. For a bottle he'll let you through, for several he'll even hook you up with gear... He's been hanging around here for a long time, they say he has no family, so he doesn't rotate out, you could say - a local landmark... Rumor has it he managed to write off a bunch of ammo and medkits somehow, and stashed it all himself. Now he trades it for vodka. Must be a decent warehouse, somewhere at Agroprom, seems like...
Had dealings with Kuznetsov, the major?

Incredibly lucky stalker. Many times his group was on the brink of death, and he was always the only one who managed to escape. Among stalkers he has a bad reputation as an unlucky talisman. For some time now he's been going solo. Better not to get involved with him, you'll be healthier... He himself is hardy. And you know why? Somewhere in Dark Valley he has a decent stash with medkits. But he won't say, the bastard, where. Says there's nothing... But I'm telling you for sure - there's a stash somewhere...

Though he's new to the Zone, he's shown himself to be a decent guy... Went into the Zone depths a couple times, and though he didn't bring back big loot, it wasn't for nothing. He doesn't charge into danger pointlessly, but doesn't hide behind his comrades' backs either. Enjoys special favor from Wolf, who often sends him on important tasks.

He used to be considered a lucky stalker, but lately prefers not to stick his neck out, either stepped on someone's tail or something else... Now he hangs around as one of Sidor's guards. Knows, damn, where to get vodka, but doesn't sell it, and out of boredom suggests playing dice... Some even manage to win against him... They say someone in the Gut brews moonshine for him and brings it here, but leaves part in an agreed place in the Gut - just in case... Worth searching for his supplies in the Gut...
Know what they say about Stas?

He's been a trader since childhood! In kindergarten he sold colored pencils. In school he traded chewing gum. In institute he dealt light drugs. When the Zone appeared, he figured you could make good money from this. Famous for being able to establish good trade relations with the most diverse clients. Better not to quarrel with him, or you won't hide even outside the Zone... I don't remember who, but someone said that Sidor has a whole warehouse with grub buried somewhere in the Gut, in case of nuclear war, so to speak. And maybe not in just one place, who knows what might happen with supplies, and grub, you understand, would be needed first, and then everything else. Oh, if I could find that winter store of his...

He's one of us... A warrior, of course, and if you go head-on, he'll order you wasted with a clear conscience, but he has a weakness for the people's drink - vodka. For a bottle he'll let you through, for several he'll even hook you up with gear... He's been hanging around here for a long time, they say he has no family, so he doesn't rotate out, you could say - a local landmark...

Incredibly lucky stalker. Many times his group was on the brink of death, and he was always the only one who managed to escape. Among stalkers he has a bad reputation as an unlucky talisman. For some time now he's been going solo. Better not to get involved with him, you'll be healthier... He himself is hardy. And you know why? Somewhere in the Gut he has a decent stash with antirad. Otherwise it's unclear why radiation doesn't affect him... I'm telling you for sure - there's a stash somewhere...

Though he's new to the Zone, he's shown himself to be a decent guy... Went into the Zone depths a couple times and though he didn't bring back big loot, it wasn't for nothing. He doesn't charge into danger pointlessly, but doesn't hide behind his comrades' backs either. Enjoys special favor from Wolf, who often sends him on important tasks... Once he told about a strange artifact - it can do this and that... We say: well show us at least... But there's none. Sold it, he says. He's lying. He wouldn't sell it, I know Petruha too well. He hid it somewhere. He hid it at Garbage, because he was there right before... And I'd look for that little artifact...

On the mainland nothing and no one was left for him, so he decided to come here. He simply has nowhere to leave the Zone. In the Zone he just makes ends meet. He owes quite a few sums of money to many stalkers. He goes to the Zone very often, but never alone, more often he latches onto groups of stalkers. But few agree to take him, because he's just extra baggage. He collects loot very rarely. Lives on handouts from other stalkers and therefore is in debt to everyone. If he asks for money - don't give... But it seems to me he only pretends to be a fool, while secretly he steals loot bit by bit and hides it. I saw him hanging around Garbage once, probably has his stash there...

Few people know Fox closely. He's buddies with Redhead and Mole. They do runs together, loot together... He rarely appears here, doesn't really talk to anyone - hello and they part ways... In general - an old loner burned by the Zone.
Want me to tell about Fox?

Rookie... Always trying to show himself as tough, but as soon as real business starts - his knees go weak... Might seem reliable to someone, but better not to have serious dealings with him... There's no proof, of course, but they sometimes say Tolik likes to rat around. No one's seen it for sure, but no one's seen him go on loot runs either, yet he brings stuff from somewhere. Like just recently from Garbage - I'm telling you for sure - he stashes something at Garbage...

Cunning, keeps to himself, but sometimes makes the crudest mistakes. Overall, leaves a mixed impression. Thin and pale. Says he came to the Zone out of curiosity and made a promise to himself: two months in the Zone - and home. But he stayed here. In his first foray into the Zone he managed to walk without devices across a field completely covered with anomalies, not knowing about them. When they told him about this, he couldn't come to his senses for a long time. Since then he celebrates that day (October 9) as his second birthday. He has a suspicious quirk - doesn't drink vodka, claims it's because of an ulcer, clearly not telling everything... As he returns from Bar, he always has several cans of energy drink with him. But he doesn't buy them, I asked Barkeep. So where does he get them? That's the thing, he has a warehouse somewhere at Bar, that's for sure...
There's this live wire here, Sparrow they call him.
They nicknamed him Nimble for his ability to be invisible and indispensable. Sidorovich sometimes uses him for delicate tasks, to follow someone, spy on something, eavesdrop.
Nimble does all the hustling for Sidor...

Give him command and he's happy. But rookies like him, he has authority among them... But in my opinion - he just admires himself... But I roughly know where his stash is. Somewhere in Dark Valley he hides artifacts - I'm telling you for sure. Well, maybe not only artifacts, but definitely there...
Fanat often runs here, I don't like him...

On the mainland nothing and no one was left for him, so he decided to come here. He simply has nowhere to leave the Zone. In the Zone he just makes ends meet. He owes quite a few sums of money to many stalkers. He goes to the Zone very often, but never alone, more often he latches onto groups of stalkers. But few agree to take him, because he's just extra baggage. He collects loot very rarely. Lives on handouts from other stalkers and therefore is in debt to everyone. If he asks for money - don't give... Between us, his act is playing dumb. But he secretly stashes stuff bit by bit. Like take Swamp, what would he do there? That's where he hides his junk...

Few people know Fox closely. He's buddies with Redhead and Mole. They do runs together, loot together... He rarely appears here, doesn't really talk to anyone - hello and they part ways... In general, an old loner burned by the Zone... Someone from Mole's group was here once, told us over a bottle that Fox has a stash somewhere at Agroprom, he goes there way too often. Not for nothing...
Want me to tell about Fox?
Rookie... Always trying to show himself as tough, but as soon as real business starts - his knees go weak... Might seem reliable to someone, but better not to have serious dealings with him...

They saw him in Dark Valley recently, he was walking satisfied, like he had just eaten and drunk... Clearly has some stash there...
There's this live wire here, Sparrow they call him.

They nicknamed him Nimble for his ability to be invisible and indispensable. Sidorovich sometimes uses him for delicate tasks, to follow someone, spy on something, eavesdrop... But he's not the only one who knows how to spy. I once spied on him too, when he went to the Gut. He wandered around there, wandered around, and came back with various junk. Brought buckshot, PM rounds, and other stuff. Sold it all and went back. He set up a stash somewhere there, so he goes there from time to time...
Nimble does all the hustling for Sidor...

Rookie... Always trying to show himself as tough, but as soon as real business starts - his knees go weak... Might seem reliable to someone, but better not to have serious dealings with him... Once some guy bragged that he had a bunch of antirad, well he had a drink, of course, and in the morning he grabs - no antirad... Well, it happens when drunk - he doesn't remember where he left it, he wiped his face and left. But I saw Tolik hanging around him, and then he slipped away somewhere. No proof, of course, but I'm telling you - he stole that antirad and hid it somewhere in Cordon until the right time...

He may be Nimble, but there's someone nimbler. Well, they spied on him once, where he runs most often - to Swamp... And why? Because he stashes his junk there...
Nimble does all the hustling for Sidor...

Give him command and he's happy. But rookies like him, he has authority among them... But in my opinion - he just admires himself... Sometimes he goes to Swamp. What would he do in Swamp? And I know - he has a stash there, he hides artifacts there. And what else if not artifacts? I'm telling you for sure - that's his stash there...
Fanat often runs here, I don't like him...

Kindest soul... Came not long ago, but has settled in well. Helps whoever he can - teaches greenhorns some sense, helps veterans with first aid, in general, a good guy. Has connections at Cordon, transports food into the Zone - we'd have died here without him... I remember he used to go on runs at first, but after several forays he completely lost heart, went into trading... they say he lost friends during his last foray, feel sorry for the guy. And on the mainland not everything was fine for him either, but he didn't spread it around. In general, that's our Cook. Hmm... And his food base is somewhere at Forgotten Village. Not for nothing does he make such a detour through the village when coming from Cordon. Probably has a storage somewhere there with supplies, doesn't drag everything to Garbage...
Don't know about our local Cook by any chance?

He's the head of Duty checkpoint at Garbage, as we say - local face control. Well, your face, between us girls, your own mother wouldn't recognize, so you won't get to Bar. Heh-heh... I'm joking. But seriously, he's a proper guy, keeps his word. He's got strength to spare... You should have seen how the other day he took down a boar with a knife - everyone was in shock, one even threw up in his gas mask, barely saved him - almost choked... heh-heh... Where he came from and how he joined Duty I don't know, ask at Bar, if he lets you through of course.

Local thugs. Nut is their ringleader. They walk around the Zone, collect tribute from greenhorns, as soon as they spot some seriously-minded stalker on the horizon, their ass starts playing, so to speak... In short, poses no danger. It even happened once that he rolled up to us after a good deal - brought a case of vodka, treated everyone - spared nothing, even hooked up my buddy with a gun! And boy did he get wasted then... ooh... Apparently on the mainland he was a keen movie fan, but that's not the point. When he started parodying Bruce Willis - what a show that was. From such laughs all the fauna within 10 kilometers scattered... "I'm a Tough Nut!" - he delivered then... in short, the guy got carried away. That's how he got the nickname Nut... He usually doesn't go far, hangs around Garbage all the time, but shows up at Cordon sometimes. He needs something at Cordon. Most likely hides loot...
Heard about the local Nut gang?

Proper stalker, tries to maintain order in the Zone as he sees it. Tough, true, sometimes, but fair. Chases local thugs around. They say he came to the Zone hiding from cops. What he did there, I don't know, didn't ask, ha-ha... And I don't advise you to... He's a guy who keeps to himself. Sometimes he wanders to Dark Valley, and from there seems to get to Foggy Thicket, devil knows how. He has something stashed there, maybe ammo, or maybe something else - who knows what Bes has, but there's a stash, there is. Can't be without it...
Bes is always settling scores with bandits...

They nicknamed him Mole because he's a former digger. With his guys he climbs into all abandoned labs and bunkers he can reach. They say they find a lot of interesting stuff there. Experienced stalker, been in many scrapes. He'll never refuse help if needed... In general, a good guy.
Many different rumors go around about Mole...

He's a young lieutenant, Kuznetsov's replacement, very new to the Zone. Doesn't drink on principle, so don't approach him with vodka. In his youth and stupidity he takes artifacts eagerly, not afraid they'll burn through his pants, ha-ha... Weapon, of course, you won't trade from him, he's too scared, but he'll let you through the bridge... They say he's afraid to deal in ammo, but he might with medicine. That's why he stashed medkits somewhere in Swamp...
Seen the new checkpoint head under the bridge at Cordon?

Has connections at Cordon, transports food into the Zone - we'd have died here without him... I remember he used to go on runs at first, but after several forays he completely lost heart, went into trading... they say he lost friends during his last foray, feel sorry for the guy. And on the mainland not everything was fine for him either, but he didn't spread it around. In general, that's our Cook. Hmm... They say he has several bases somewhere in Swamp. Food and medkits there. Doesn't drag everything to Garbage...
Don't know about our local Cook by any chance?

But that's not the point, the point is where does he stash them? And I'll tell you where: they tracked once where he runs from time to time - to Foggy Thicket! Why? Well there - he stashes artifacts, what else...

Someone said he stashed his goods there, and now can't find them himself. Probably when drunk. Or maybe another reason, maybe he stashed in underground, but is afraid to climb down, so he waits for the right moment. In general, he has a stash there somewhere, and probably in the basements somewhere...

When he's not on duty, he goes to Swamp, they've seen him there. Probably takes his trinkets there, worth looking around there somewhere...
Seen the new checkpoint head under the bridge at Cordon?

On the mainland nothing and no one was left for him, so he decided to come here. He simply has nowhere to leave the Zone. In the Zone he just makes ends meet. He owes quite a few sums of money to many stalkers. He goes to the Zone very often, but never alone, more often he latches onto groups of stalkers. But few agree to take him, because he's just extra baggage. He collects loot very rarely. Lives on handouts from other stalkers and therefore is in debt to everyone. If he asks for money - don't give...

Few people know Fox closely. He's buddies with Redhead and Mole. They do runs together, loot together... He rarely appears here, doesn't really talk to anyone - hello and they part ways... In general - an old loner burned by the Zone.
Want me to tell about Fox?
Rookie... Always trying to show himself as tough, but as soon as real business starts - his knees go weak... Might seem reliable to someone, but better not to have serious dealings with him...

Cunning, keeps to himself, but sometimes makes the crudest mistakes. Overall, leaves a mixed impression. Thin and pale. Says he came to the Zone out of curiosity and made a promise to himself: two months in the Zone - and home. But he stayed here. In his first foray into the Zone he managed to walk without devices across a field completely covered with anomalies, not knowing about them. When they told him about this, he couldn't come to his senses for a long time. Since then he celebrates that day (October 9) as his second birthday. He has a suspicious quirk - doesn't drink vodka, claims it's because of an ulcer, clearly not telling everything.
There's this live wire here, Sparrow they call him
They nicknamed him Nimble for his ability to be invisible and indispensable. Sidorovich sometimes uses him for delicate tasks, to follow someone, spy on something, eavesdrop.
Nimble does all the hustling for Sidor...
Give him command and he's happy. But rookies like him, he has authority among them... But in my opinion - he just admires himself.
Fanat often runs here, I don't like him...

Fanat often runs here, I don't like him...

Former OMON, principled to the core... One problem - he's used to solving all problems with force alone, straight as a post, no flexibility. And you know how he came to the Zone? Along with his buddies. Most of them still stick together with him. Naturally, with such a biography he has a straight road to Duty. Once he joined, he serves. Now he's already commander of their special forces... But, honestly speaking, you can't live on principles alone, so he also puts aside something for a rainy day. They saw him stashing loot at Warehouses. Can't say exactly where, but somewhere there - for sure, not for nothing does he always graze there...

Know what he was? A locksmith at the refrigerator factory. His wife left him, so he decided to end his life, and chose going to the Zone as the method. He rubbed shoulders here for a couple years and won a certain authority among stalkers, thanks to his professional skills. At the moment Master is the most competent locksmith in the Zone, repair of equipment and machinery, setting up defense systems for faction bunkers and so on - his domain. Has access to any doors, influential, simple, but rough in communication.

Former detective, left the police because he dug up info on some bigshot. They were already planning to set him up, so he went to the Zone to avoid getting caught. Immediately joined Duty. Leads punitive operations and operations to clear out large mutant clusters. In general, honest serviceman and a smart guy. Knows how to talk to people... Like all smart guys he doesn't live on slogans alone. He hides something in Wild Territory. Maybe ammo, maybe artifacts - who knows what, but definitely there...
Better not to mess with Ivancov.

He's a self-taught tech for guns and armor. Came to the Zone as an ordinary stalker, and already here discovered his talent for this business: fixed one guy's gun, patched another's armor - the guys started respecting him. As soon as Barkeep heard about him, he immediately took him in, both Lanky feels safer under a roof, and Barkeep gets extra customers. If the breakdown is serious - bring it to him, he'll restore it, the gun will be like new. He can upgrade weapons, put optics there, fiddle with magazines. Makes custom armor. But that's already on individual basis, you gotta talk to him... He has a storage somewhere here on Bar territory, would be good to check what he keeps...
If you need to repair something, go to Lanky.

Electronics specialist. Barkeep brought him from the mainland, he worked at some research institute there for an engineer's salary, ha-ha... They say he pays him well, and guards him like the apple of his eye. If you have problems with your PDA, straight road to him. For extra fee he can install some upgrades for you too. Ah, if you lost someone in the Zone - also to him, he'll set up your PDA to search for the missing person.

No idea where he's from, but he knows a lot. Usually you can find him in the bar, he trades information there, buys blueprints, documents and records from labs. Who he's connected with, hell knows, but people are wary of him... In other words, a shady type, I don't deal with him... Tooth is no simple guy. And if so, then he must have stashes stuffed all over the Zone. Hell, I even roughly know there's one at Yantar...
There's this guy hanging around Bar - Tooth, everyone calls him that...

Former OMON, principled to the core... One problem - he's used to solving all problems with force alone, straight as a post, no flexibility. And you know how he came to the Zone? Now he's already commander of their special forces... You can't live on principles alone, so he doesn't disdain artifacts either. They saw him at Yantar, seems like, so that's where he hides something...

He rubbed shoulders here for a couple years and won a certain authority among stalkers thanks to his professional skills. At the moment Master is the most competent locksmith in the Zone, repair of equipment and machinery, setting up defense systems for faction bunkers and so on - his domain. Has access to any doors, influential, simple, but rough in communication... Recently the guys saw him at Wild Territory. What brought him there? Must be he has a stash too, like all normal stalkers. Yeah, you can't hide an awl in a sack, definitely his stash is at Wild Territory...

But that's already on individual basis, you gotta talk to him... He set up a warehouse somewhere nearby. Even at Garbage, seems like. And why not - no one would guess, the simpler the better...
If you need to repair something, go to Lanky.

And if you lost someone in the Zone - also to him, he'll set up your PDA to search for the missing person... People often bring him artifacts for various work, but he doesn't sell them, just hides them somewhere. And where - no need to think here, somewhere at Warehouses. He was there very recently, and before that I gave him an artifact for a belt. I'm telling you for sure - his stash is at Warehouses...

No idea where he's from, but he knows a lot. Usually you can find him in the bar, he trades information there, buys blueprints, documents and records from labs. Who he's connected with, hell knows, but people are wary of him... In other words, a shady type, I don't deal with him.

Must be he has something to hide, if he goes so far...

And if you lost someone in the Zone - also to him, he'll set up your PDA to search for the missing person... People often bring him artifacts for various work, but he doesn't sell them, just hides them somewhere. I think he hides them right here somewhere, at Bar...

No idea where he's from, but he knows a lot. Usually you can find him in the bar, he trades information there, buys blueprints, documents and records from labs. Who he's connected with, hell knows, but people are wary of him... In other words, a shady type, I don't deal with him... And they also say he does some business with Sultan. Sultan needs modificates, and Tooth trades recipes, well, gets some share of his business too. Complex scheme. But that's not the point, the point is that Toothy stores artifacts at Forgotten Village. I bet you anything they're there...
There's this guy hanging around Bar - Tooth, everyone calls him that...
U-h-h... Seems like that's all, don't know anything else...
Listen, fuck off, somethin' ain't right with me...
You're pissin' me off... Let me rest at least...
Modificates - Soul Drop, Electra's Tears, Fire Empty, Granny's Beads, Porcupine, Steel Ball, Hide...
Mezomodificates - Fire Soul, Tears of Fire, Great-granny's Beads, Bright Empty, Electric Porcupine, Titanium Ball, Scale...
Hypermodificates - Crystal Soul, Chimera's Tears, Burner granny's Beads, Moon Empty, Snotty Porcupine, Diamond Ball, Shell...
Absolutes - Bengal Crystal Soul, Giant's Tear, Pudding, Burrer great-granny's Beads, Stone Porcupine, Giant's Little Brother, Controller's Scalp...

At Cordon on the territory of the southern checkpoint in the bushes there's a crate with weapons. Better not mess with the soldiers - quietly go around from the eastern side, through the fallen tree. The first bush there is yours.
In the swamp there's an old road from the vehicle yard westward. On the road stands a truck, look in the back... Plenty of beasts there - don't go without good gear...

In the swamp there's an old fishing hamlet, also a water tower stands nearby... So near this tower there's a little basement, look there... Just be careful - there's strong radiation in the basement...
Dogs attacked along with tushkanos, barely escaped! Had to drop the container. I remember the place - before reaching the pig farm, to the right of the road, near a distinctive stump
Under the harmonica's cover there's a sheet with incomprehensible text!
So-o... Soldiers, skeletons, one in an egghead suit... Probably that very group that left Cordon with Ghost.
Equipment is mangled... Looks like that very convoy Mikhalych was talking about. They were either looking for something... or wanted to take something out?
So so... Military crates, apparently with weapons... Let's see...
Blockage! Clearly can't get through here. Though... If I ask a couple, or better yet - four - guys to help, seems like it can be cleared.
at Forgotten Village, there's also some barn right above the ravine.
somewhere in the abandoned vehicle junkyard.
at Cordon, somewhere at the farms.
Information about a new path found!
Code combination of blocked door discovered!
Looks like this is that very electronic notebook. Yeah, there's even engraving on the back of the case - {Vergas-08}.\nRaven will be pleased.
Looks like this is that very electronic notebook. Yeah, there's even engraving on the back of the case - {Vergas-08}.\nOnly it won't turn on for some reason... Need to show it to a master.
Stalker! Stop and don't move! They'll come to you now...
Yo! Come to the sign and don't wave your gun, let's chat...
What the hell! You don't get it?! Go to the sign and stand! We'll waste you, fo' real...
How am I supposed to light a fire without matches?!
Device doesn't work. No power. Need a charged battery.
Here I can replace the harmonizer-setpoint block, but I don't have the needed item.
Data processing in progress, please wait...
Nothing to repair with! Need a toolbox.
Kinda sketchy going into that tunnel. Wouldn't it be better to go back to Wolf, let him give something simpler?
Looks like this is what Wolf needs.
My deputy, Ivancov, has sniffed out something
I was able to pick up the weapon without any 'tools'!\nIs it really about me? Or... about being close to the Monolith?
I couldn't pick up the weapon with the tool last time, but I managed to do it now!\nIs it really about me? Or... about being close to the Monolith?
How can this be? So the tool doesn't work... \nOr is it not about that at all? \nThe mercenaries were wrong, it's not meant for weapons. But what then?
Aha, found the radio station. Need to take it to Bootlegger
Aha! Can go back to Cordon. And I should find out who this Borov is...
Orders, hmm... Some codes... Let's see.
Scraps of paper, scribbled sheets, maybe something interesting?
So-o. Leave artifact and battery near electra - done. Now wait a couple hours to be sure.
I'm standing pretty far from the anomaly, I think.
My gut tells me I should start with the artifact, then put out the battery.
Marked One, come over, seems like it worked
Psi-field intensity measurement started, do not lift device until cycle is complete!
Too much damage! I can't fix this myself.
What am I planning to repair anyway?!
I can't fix this with my bare hands. Hell, can anyone in the Zone even do it?
